snippet: In the next six months, factional candidates have their best chance to break out from the pack and do some harm to their more mainstream rivals.
abstract: The Upshot; first Republican primary debate marks new phase in presidential campaign in which popular status of field of candidates could be upended and transformed; while race will continue to favor mainstream Republican candidates, the six months between debate and primaries and caucuses could allow those who appeal to smaller, specific factions within party to broaden their appeal and support.
lead_paragraph: In the next six months, factional candidates have their best chance to break out from the pack and do some harm to their more mainstream rivals.

headline.print_headline: Next Phase of G.O.P. Race Starts Now
headline.main: The Next Phase of the G.O.P. Race Starts Now
